Access to Ayurveda Privacy Policy
Our Privacy Policy

For the purpose of this Privacy Policy (“Privacy Policy” or “Policy”), wherever the context so requires "You" or "User" shall mean any natural or legal person using the website www.accesstoayurveda.com (“the Site”) in any manner whatsoever including but not limited to accessing and browsing the Site, and registered users as may be applicable, and the term "We", "Us", "Our" shall mean Access to Ayurveda, a company incorporated in Oregon (“the Company”) its affiliates, successors-in-interest, and permitted assigns.
We will always, ALWAYS, respect your privacy, your email address, and the information you give us. We’re not going to sell it, trade it, or abuse any information you submit to us.
How’s my information going to be used?
When you sign up you’ll only get relevant information about Access to Ayurveda it’s services and products.
How do I to stop receiving emails from you in the future?

If you wish to stop receiving emails from us, you may unsubscribe at any time using the link provided at the bottom of all our emails. But if you’re still receiving emails from us, don’t worry, our support team will be there to assist you!
Who’s going to get my information?
Your information’s safe with us. The emails you will receive will always be sent from us and only us.
What if I email you guys?
Your emails are confidential, and we won’t share your email, data, or email address.
Your privacy is very important to us.

We want to make your experience on the Site as rewarding as possible. We have created this Privacy Policy to demonstrate our firm commitment to privacy and security. This Privacy Policy describes how our company collects information from all end users of our Internet services (“the Services”). This Privacy Policy explains what we do with the information we collect.
Privacy

We view the protection of your privacy as extremely important and we store and process your personal information including any financial or medical information in accordance with applicable law,  the rules made thereunder, and this Privacy Policy. In the event you have any objection to this please do not use the Site.
COLLECTION AND USAGE OF YOUR INFORMATION
Sign-up

Users will be required to provide certain personal information when they sign up for Services including their name, address, email, telephone number, billing information (such as a credit card number). The Company also collects information regarding the type of personal computer/mobile devices & tablets/ any other digital device use to access our services or application being used to access the Services. The personal information collected from Users during the registration process (or at any other time) is used primarily to provide and improve Services. This includes using the personal information to process the order placed by you.

Your information will never be licensed or sold to any third party without your consent. However, we may make limited disclosure of personal information under the specific circumstances described in the “Disclosure” section below.
Responses to email inquiries

When you communicate with us or other users regarding products, services and for any other enquiry by phone, post, email or any other medium, we collect the content of your messages. This information will be used by us to address your query, to provide and improve the services.
Automatic Collection of Information
Cookies

: Our Company uses “Cookies” to collect information which includes, without limitation, third-party cookies like Google and Facebook. Accepting Cookies is not a prerequisite for using the Site. We would, however, like to point out that the Cookies are important for analytics. You can accordingly select if you wish to activate or deactivate cookies using the settings available in your browser. Cookies are small pieces of information stored by your browser on your computer’s hard drive, at a web site’s request. The Company Cookies do not collect any personal information. The Cookies are used primarily for the following purposes:
• to store your preferences and settings on your device and to enhance your experience;
to store your preferences and settings on your device and to enhance your experience;
• to collect and record information about what you viewed on the Site and what you viewed in our e-mail;
to collect and record information about what you viewed on the Site and what you viewed in our e-mail;
• to manage and present site information and the pictures displayed on your computer,
to manage and present site information and the pictures displayed on your computer,
• to collect data about your online activity and identify your interests so that we can provide advertising/information that is most relevant to you;
to collect data about your online activity and identify your interests so that we can provide advertising/information that is most relevant to you;
The Cookies used by the Site may come from the Company.
Our services use three categories of Cookies:

• Necessary Cookies: These Cookies are required for optimal navigation and operation of the Site. For example, these Cookies are used to implement the basket function, such that the goods in your basket stay saved while you continue with the purchase. The necessary Cookies also serve to save inputs and settings which you have made so that you don’t have to constantly repeat them, and to adapt Company’s content to your individual interests. Only limited use of the Site is possible without necessary Cookies.
Necessary Cookies:

These Cookies are required for optimal navigation and operation of the Site. For example, these Cookies are used to implement the basket function, such that the goods in your basket stay saved while you continue with the purchase. The necessary Cookies also serve to save inputs and settings which you have made so that you don’t have to constantly repeat them, and to adapt Company’s content to your individual interests. Only limited use of the Site is possible without necessary Cookies.

• Statistical Cookies: These Cookies collect device and access data to analyze the use of the Site, such as which areas of the Site are used how (so-called surfing behavior), how fast content is loaded and whether errors occur. These Cookies only contain anonymous or pseudonymous information and are only used to improve the Site and to find out what our users are interested in, and to measure how effective our advertising is. Statistical Cookies can be blocked without adversely affecting the navigation and operation of the Site.
Statistical Cookies:

These Cookies collect device and access data to analyze the use of the Site, such as which areas of the Site are used how (so-called surfing behavior), how fast content is loaded and whether errors occur. These Cookies only contain anonymous or pseudonymous information and are only used to improve the Site and to find out what our users are interested in, and to measure how effective our advertising is. Statistical Cookies can be blocked without adversely affecting the navigation and operation of the Site.
With your consent

: We share information about you with third parties when you give us consent to do so.  For example, we often display personal testimonials of satisfied customers on our public websites. With your consent, we may post your name alongside the testimonial.
For Crime Prevention and Investigation

We may share information about you with a third party if we believe that sharing is reasonably necessary to (a) comply with any applicable law, regulation, legal process or governmental request, including to meet national security requirements, (b) enforce our agreements, policies and terms of service, (c) protect the security or integrity of our products and services, (d) protect, our users or the public from harm or illegal activities, or (e) prevent, detect, mitigate, and investigate fraudulent or illegal activities related to the Site.
Legal basis:

If your data is processed to prevent fraud at your expense, the legal basis is Article 6 (1) b GDPR. This processing of your data otherwise occurs on the basis of Article 6 (1) f GDPR, based on our legitimate interest and that of other users in the identification and prevention of fraud and clarification of criminal offences.
TRANSFER OF DATA

We forward your data if it is permissible under the applicable law. We work particularly closely with certain service providers, for example with technical service providers (e.g. running computer centers, cloud platform for storing the data) or with logistics companies or payment gateway service provider. These service providers may generally only process your data on our behalf under special conditions. Where we use them to process orders, the service providers only receive access to your data in the scope and for the time required for provision of the relevant service. If they process your data outside the European Union, this may mean that your data is transmitted to a country with a lower data protection standard than the European Union. In such cases we will ensure that the relevant service providers contractually or otherwise
HOW TO ACCESS AND CONTROL YOUR INFORMATION

You have a right to be informed of personal data processed by the Company (Article 15 GDPR), a right to rectification/correction (Article 16 GDPR), deletion (Article 17 GDPR) and restriction of processing (Article 18 GDPR), right to data portability (Article 20 GDPR), right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority (Article 77 GDPR), right to withdraw consent (Article 7 (3) GDPR) as well as the right to object to particular data processing measures (Article 21 GDPR). In order to ensure that your data is not disclosed to third parties in the course of requests for information, please attach sufficient proof of identity to your request by email or post. We cannot provide, rectify or delete any other user’s data that we store on behalf of our users or customers.
To exercise any of the rights mentioned in this Privacy Policy and/or in the event of questions or comments relating to the use of Personal Data you may contact info@accesstoayurveda.com

Your request and choices may be limited in certain cases: for example, if fulfilling your request would reveal information about another person, or if you ask to delete information which we or your administrator are permitted by law or have compelling legitimate interests to keep.
Withdrawal of Consent

If you have given consent for the processing of your data, you may withdraw it at any time. Withdrawal has no effect on the lawfulness of the processing of your data which took place before such withdrawal.
Update your Information
You can update your profile information within your profile settings and modify content that contains information about you using the editing tools associated with that content
Delete your Information:
Please note, however, that we may need to retain certain information for record keeping purposes, to complete transactions or to comply with our legal obligations.
Request that we stop using your information:

In some cases, you may ask us to restrict or stop accessing, storing, using and otherwise processing your information.  For example, You can also opt-out of our use of your information for marketing purposes, when you have earlier consented for it.
Opt out of Communications

: You may opt out of receiving communications from us by using the unsubscribe link within each email, or by contacting us as provided below to have your contact information removed from our promotional email list or registration database.
OUR COMPANY’S COMMITMENT TO DATA SECURITY

We implement a variety of administrative, managerial, and technical security measures to help protect your personal information. We transmit your personal data securely using encryption. This applies to your order and your customer login. We do this using the coding system SSL (Secure Socket Layer).  The Company has various internal control standards which relate specifically to the handling of personal information. These include certain controls to help safeguard the information we collect online. Our employees are trained to understand and comply with these controls and we communicate our Privacy Policy, practices and guidelines to our employees. However, while we strive to protect your personal information, you must also take steps to protect your information. We urge you to take every precaution to protect your personal information while you are on the Internet.
RETENTION OF DATA

We will store your usage data as long as is necessary for the purposes named in the Policy, especially for the fulfilment of our contractual and legal obligations, or until such time when you request for its deletion. We may also store your personal data for other purposes if or as long as the law allows us store it for particular purposes, including for defense against legal claims.

If you delete your account, we will delete all the data we have stored regarding you. If it is not possible or necessary to completely delete your data for legal reasons, the relevant data will be restricted for further processing. Even if your data is not subject to any legal retention obligation, we may refrain in the cases allowed by the law from immediate deletion and instead restrict processing. This applies especially in cases where we may need the relevant data for further contractual processing or prosecution or legal defense (e.g. in the event of complaints).
Deletion may be waived in the cases allowed by law if the data is anonymous or pseudonymous and deletion would rule out or seriously hinder processing for scientific research or statistical purposes.
Information We Collect

You may choose to provide personal information to us in a number of ways, such as when you participate in an offer or promotion, or when you make a purchase on our site, via our social media pages or through one of our mobile applications. The types of personal information you may provide to us includes:
1. Personal or business contact information (such as name, address and email address, social media, name of your company or department, and your business function or title);
Personal or business contact information (such as name, address and email address, social media, name of your company or department, and your business function or title);
2. A general geographic location (such as country and city) from which a visitor accesses our sites;
A general geographic location (such as country and city) from which a visitor accesses our sites;
Children's Privacy

Our sites are not directed to children under 13. We do not knowingly collect, use or disclose personally identifiable information from anyone under 13 years of age. If we determine upon collection that a user is under this age, we will not use or maintain their personal information without the parent/guardian's consent. If we become aware that we have unknowingly collected personally identifiable information from a child under the age of 13, we will make reasonable efforts to delete such information from our records.
REVISIONS TO THIS POLICY

The Company reserves the right to revise, amend, or modify the Privacy Policy and our terms of use, and our other policies and agreements at any time and in any manner. When we post changes to this statement, we will revise the “last updated” date at the top of the statement. If there are material changes to the statement, such as a change to the purposes of processing of personal data that is not consistent with the purpose for which it was originally collected, we will notify you either by prominently posting a notice of such changes before they take effect or by directly sending you a notification. We encourage you to periodically review this policy.
If certain changes require us to take your consent then such changes shall only be made with your consent.
If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy or the practices described herein, you may contact our data protection officer at: info@accesstoayurveda.com
Thanks so much for reading the Policy.
